entry.title: Combined summary - Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
entry.summary: The email discusses the challenges of scaling the Lightning Network in a trust-free manner, focusing on creating Lightning channels for casual users. It suggests using covenant-based protocols enabled by CheckTemplateVerify (CTV) or AnyPrevOut (APO) to eliminate the need for casual users to co-own an on-chain UTXO and obtain signatures from them. The email introduces the concept of simple covenants and timeout-trees to enable the creation of Lightning channels for a large number of users without requiring their signatures. It also proposes using a variation of the FFO-WF Lightning channel protocol to facilitate the rollover of funds for casual users. Additionally, the email highlights the importance of off-chain bitcoin and suggests incorporating mechanisms like CTV or APO in Bitcoin's consensus rules to improve scalability and usability of Lightning. Overall, the email presents solutions to improve scalability in the Lightning Network and make it a widely-used means of payment.
